title.rendered: Community Health camp organized for the people of Jammu and Kashmir

content.rendered:
A six day community health camp was organized for the people residing in various towns in the Udhampur district of Jammu and Kashmir. Inaccessibility of hospitals due to the strenuous walks up and down the mountains makes it impossible for the people living in the remote villages to avail healthcare services. To make healthcare services easily available Smile on Wheels mobile hospital conducted a door to door visit to the community residing in Udhampur and services like routine health check-up, blood sugar check-up were provide; counseling and sensitizing activities were conducted for the residents along with which anemia & personal hygiene sessions were also conducted for the women. People were greatly benefitted from the various services provided.

Smile on Wheels programme at present has 34 operational projects in 265 remote villages and urban slums across India, directly benefitting over 400,000 lives in a year.
